p: The effective concentration (EC 50) of 5c and 5d was determined from antiviral curves. The EC 50 of 5c compound was 26.14 μM ( Figure 4 a) with a selectivity index (CC 50/EC 50) of 4.33 (CC 50 = 113.4 μM ( Figure 3 a)). The EC 50 of 5d compound was 28.39 μM ( Figure 4 b; selectivity index = 4.19; CC 50 = 119 μM ( Figure 3 b)). The reported EC 50 values are the means of two experiments, which are performed in triplicates. It clearly shows that 4′-halogenated dihydrorugosaflavonoids ( 5c and 5d) possess better inhibitory potential than other substituted dihydrorugosaflavonoid compounds for CHIKV.
